org.sakaiproject.authz.impl

Class SakaiSecurity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.authz.impl.SakaiSecurity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SecurityService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SakaiSecurityTest

    public abstract class SakaiSecurity
extends Object
implements SecurityService

    SakaiSecurity is a Sakai security service.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String ADVISOR_STACK
      ThreadLocalManager key for our SecurityAdvisor Stack.
      protected static String EVENT_ROLESWAP_CLEAR
      The update event to post to clear cached security lookups involving the authz group
      protected int m_cacheMinutes
      The # minutes to cache the security answers. 0 disables the cache.
      protected MultiRefCache m_callCache
      A cache of calls to the service and the results.
      protected static String ROLESWAP_PREFIX
      Session attribute to store roleswap state

      • unlock

        public boolean unlock(String userId,
             String function,
             String entityRef,
             Collection<String> azgs)
        Can the specified user id unlock the lock for use with this resource (using these authzGroups for the check)?
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        userId - The user id.
        function - The lock id string.
        entityRef - The resource reference string.
        azgs - The set of authz group ids to use for the check (the reference is not consulted).
        Returns:
        true, if the user can unlock the lock, false otherwise.

      • checkAuthzGroups

        protected boolean checkAuthzGroups(String userId,
                       String function,
                       String entityRef,
                       Collection<String> azgs)
        Check the appropriate AuthzGroups for the answer - this may be cached
        Parameters:
        userId - The user id.
        function - The security function.
        entityRef - The entity reference string.
        Returns:
        true if allowed, false if not.

      • unlockUsers

        public List<User> unlockUsers(String lock,
                     String reference)
        Access the List the Users who can unlock the lock for use with this resource.
        Specified by:
        unlockUsers in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        lock - The lock id string.
        reference - The resource reference string.
        Returns:
        A List (User) of the users can unlock the lock (may be empty).

      • getAdvisorStack

        protected Stack<SecurityAdvisor> getAdvisorStack(boolean force)
        Get the thread-local security advisor stack, possibly creating it
        Parameters:
        force - if true, create if missing

      • dropAdvisorStack

        protected void dropAdvisorStack()
        Remove the thread-local security advisor stack

      • adviseIsAllowed

        protected SecurityAdvisor.SecurityAdvice adviseIsAllowed(String userId,
                                             String function,
                                             String reference)
        Check the advisor stack - if anyone declares ALLOWED or NOT_ALLOWED, stop and return that, else, while they PASS, keep checking.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user id.
        function - The security function.
        reference - The Entity reference.
        Returns:
        ALLOWED or NOT_ALLOWED if an advisor makes a decision, or PASS if there are no advisors or they cannot make a decision.

      • pushAdvisor

        public void pushAdvisor(SecurityAdvisor advisor)
        Establish a new SecurityAdvisor for this thread, at the top of the stack (it gets first dibs on the answer).
        Specified by:
        pushAdvisor in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        advisor - The advisor to establish

      • popAdvisor

        public SecurityAdvisor popAdvisor(SecurityAdvisor advisor)
        Remove the designated SecurityAdvisor from the top of the Stack
        Specified by:
        popAdvisor in interface SecurityService
        Returns:
        the SecurityAdvisor or null if the passed security advisor is not at the top of the stack

      • popAdvisor

        public SecurityAdvisor popAdvisor()
        Description copied from interface: SecurityService
        Remove one SecurityAdvisor from the stack for this thread, if any exist.
        Specified by:
        popAdvisor in interface SecurityService
        Returns:
        advisor The advisor popped of, or null if the stack is empty.

      • hasAdvisors

        public boolean hasAdvisors()
        Check if there are any security advisors stacked for this thread.
        Specified by:
        hasAdvisors in interface SecurityService
        Returns:
        true if some advisors are defined, false if not.

      • clearAdvisors

        public void clearAdvisors()
        Remove any SecurityAdvisors from this thread. WARNING:This method should not be used as it removes all security advisors, not only the one from the calling method rather use SecurityService.popAdvisor()
        Specified by:
        clearAdvisors in interface SecurityService

      • setUserEffectiveRole

        public boolean setUserEffectiveRole(String azGroupId,
                           String role)
        Set the current user's effective role in this authz group for security lookups in this session.
        Specified by:
        setUserEffectiveRole in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        azGroupId - The authz group id
        role - The role id to assume (must be a valid role in the authz group)
        Returns:
        true, if the user can switch roles in this authz group and the role is set, otherwise false.

      • getUserEffectiveRole

        public String getUserEffectiveRole(String azGroupId)
        Get the current user's effective role in this authz group for security lookups in this session.
        Specified by:
        getUserEffectiveRole in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        azGroupId - The authz group id
        Returns:
        The user's effective role if set, otherwise null

      • clearUserEffectiveRole

        public void clearUserEffectiveRole(String azGroupId)
        Clear the current user's effective role in this authz group.
        Specified by:
        clearUserEffectiveRole in interface SecurityService
        Parameters:
        azGroupId - The authz group id

      • clearUserEffectiveRoles

        public void clearUserEffectiveRoles()
        Clear all effective roles for this user. Should be called on logout.
        Specified by:
        clearUserEffectiveRoles in interface SecurityService

      • resetSecurityCache

        protected void resetSecurityCache(String azGroupId)
        Clear the results of security lookups involving the given authz group from the security lookup cache.
        Parameters:
        azGroupId - The authz group id.
